intro: Armeria alpina subsp. confusa, commonly known as the alpine thrift, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of pink or white flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to harsh alpine environments. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine displays.
